name: Hanoi Guesthouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fantastic guesthouse. It is in the old city and within walking distance of everything in the old city. It is easy to get to from the airport by the airport bus (you will need to get a taxi from where the bus stops but that will cost very little). If you arrive late at night I recommend using the hostel's pick-up service. The guest house is very clean (cleaned daily) and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. There is free wifi and internet which works well throughout the guesthouse. The price is very reasonable and the breakfast is adequate, free tea/coffee and water are available all day. The tours to Ha Long Bay are professional and reasonably priced (a two day trip can be had from $45 US). The staff will book train tickets for you at no commission. Above all though, the staff are what make the guesthouse such a fantastic place. The staff are extremely attentive, they manage to remember everyone's name and will give you every tip they can about how to get by in Hanoi. At meal times, if you are lucky, they will share their food with you (great food) and if there is any spare food left over let you have it for snacks throughout the day. We loved Miss Chou and the rest of the girls, they are the nicest people we have met in any accommodation in nearly five years of traveling. I would stay here again without hesitation.
reviews.title: Brilliant - great place, exceptional staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in Hanoi weary and tired after a morning flight and were enthusiastically greeted when we arrived at the Hanoi Guesthouse. We were offered our choice of the top floor room surrounded by windows, or a similar lower floor room, which would be less bright, but slightly quieter. We chose the top floor room and enjoyed it thoroughly.
reviews.title: Traveled for 4 weeks: this was the best accomodation on my journey.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service that we received from both of the managers Miss Châu and Miss Hăng was absolutely fabulous, from the food recommendations, tour descriptions, personal welcome and greeting, and their commitment to customer service. Near the end of our stay, I got a very severe stomach flu, and the staff showed us where to buy takeout soup and offered to accompany us to the hospital for interpretation if it came down to it (which we luckily did not have to do). They also managed to cancel our perfume pagoda tour on very short notice. I would also like to acknowledge their other front desk staff, Mr Hâi and Miss Uyen.
reviews.title: Friendliness Unsurpassed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast that is included is absolutely delicious, coming from one of the nearby restaurants. We booked our Halong Bay tour through the guesthouse and would happily stay here and book tours through them again.
reviews.title: Brilliant - Miss Chang was SO helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Through our month-long journey, the Hanoi Guesthouse was our favorite accommodation for the exceptional service, quality, and value.
reviews.title: A wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had a wonderful experince at this guesthouse where the staffs are all very friendly and nice to us. They helped to arrange our tours and get our train tickets to hue, it was fabulous service. love thier serivce and hospitality
reviews.title: the staffs are friendly and warm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010
reviews.text: The guesthouse was either fully booked or the renovations next door were too noisy each time I was in Hanoi between tours. However Miss Chau booked me in a few doors down at Stars Hotel for the same price. Each morning I breakfasted at Hanoi Guesthouse, they remembered my name, were very helpful and always asked how the art gallery was, did I like the massage, the tour etc.
reviews.title: Caring and attentive staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The room at Stars was good and the guys were nice however Miss Chau, Hang and the team at Hanoi Guesthouse were the best with service.
reviews.title: You couldn't ask for nicer hosts!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went to Vietnam by myself and chose this hotel based on the other reviews from Trip Advisor and I was very glad I did.
reviews.title: You'll find love and care here, no regret staying

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I couldn't find my ride at the airport and one call to the hotel and their reassuring voice that they would get me there safely, was amazing... especially since I forgot to print my travel confirmation with them and was alone.
reviews.title: good location/value for money/ friendly staffs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: For backpacker, or event normal leisure, i think this is a good place to stay, the guesthouse staffs are all very helpful and friendly. This is what we wished for whenever we reach a new place without direction. The location of the guesthouse is good. We walked all the way around the town and visited all the famous spots on an average distant. The guesthouse offered tour package which are affordable and the attendants are honest enough to inform us all the necessary tips for each trip to make sure you have an enjoyable trip.
reviews.title: Staff are very friendly and helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at Hanoi guesthouse are outstanding. They can't do enough to help you and they are up for a bit of banter too. We were pleasantly surprised that there was no hard sell - of anything. They have plenty of information on hand to help you make choices but you're very much left to make your own decison.
reviews.title: Compact and clean rooms, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: The rooms are clean but they are small. Wifi was free and the connection was good.
reviews.title: Believe it or not, I really did feel like a family member; indeed, a home away from home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is included in the price of the room. Brekkie is simple but good (baguette or noodle soup with choice of beverage).
reviews.title: People make the difference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: There is a construction site next door that does cause some noise however with the use of earplugs we had a good nights sleep. The hotel contacted us about this before we arrived and offered us alternative accommodation if we wanted to move (which we didn't!).
reviews.title: great staff at Hanoi Guesthouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed at Hanoi guesthouse early November.The guesthouse is located in Bat Su Street in the heart of Hanoi Old Quarter..The place to stay in Hanoi.Location of the hotel is fantastic,the staff are the friendliest i have encountered on my travels throughout asia,from booking Halong Bay cruises to day trips or hotel and bar recommendations they are great and i was always happy with there recommendations..i booked a halong bay cruise and also an overnight sleeper to Hue with them and both trips were great.Every member of staff greeted me with a smile and were always available for a chat.Would i recommend Hanoi Guesthouse i would 100 % and will hopefully be back in 2011....
reviews.title: Fantastic staff Fantastic Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Guest house staff have a warm welcome when we reached there...A smile face make the whole journey a good start.
reviews.title: A nice stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Friendly staff like good friends of you... a nice breakfast served ...(highly recommend the beef noodle next to guest house)
reviews.title: traveling with a peace of mind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Provide informative information for city tour...
reviews.title: All staffs are very nice and helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Packages took from guest house are good and enjoyable.
reviews.title: Good stay

description: Hanoi Guesthouse is proudly located in the center of Old Quarter, next to Hanoi Heritage House. It takes only 3 minutes to Hoan Kiem Lake, Ngoc Son Temple, Water Puppet Theater, also walking distance to Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum and Museum, The Temple of Literature. There are many restaurants around such as Tamarind Cafe, Lady Bird, A New Day...This cozy and friendly Guesthouse has different room types such as standard rooms, superior rooms, deluxe rooms that perfectly suit for Single, Couple, Family travelers.Rooms are super clean, thoughtfully decorated with wooden furnishings, wooden floors.* Facility: included Elevator (Lift) serves all floors.* Room features:The room provides Satellite TV, Minibar, Air-conditioning, Fan, Internet access – wireless, Computer in lobby (Complimentary), Refrigerator, Desk, Sitting area,Telephone, Hair dryer, Slippers, Private bathroom with hot shower, bathtub, bathroom amenities, Wake up service/Alarm clock... Superior room with window, Deluxe room with balcony or Old Quarter view. The room rates are inclusive of breakfast, tax, Free Internet, Free WiFi access.
